actor_awards.notes: Best known for his scene-stealing comedic roles, particularly his Academy Award-nominated performance as Benzino Napaloni in Chaplin's 'The Great Dictator'. He was often cast as the wisecracking sidekick.

filmography.title: The Great Dictator
filmography.role_description: The boisterous, food-fighting dictator of Bacteria, a parody of Benito Mussolini.
filmography.plot: A Jewish barber who looks exactly like the tyrannical dictator of Tomania tries to survive the regime while the dictator plans world conquest.

filmography.title: The Call of the Wild
filmography.role_description: A prospector and good-natured sidekick to Clark Gable's character in the Yukon.
filmography.plot: A prospector heads to the Yukon during the Gold Rush and befriends a wild dog named Buck.

filmography.title: Thieves' Highway
filmography.role_description: A truck driver who partners with the protagonist to deliver produce to a corrupt market.
filmography.plot: A war veteran becomes a truck driver to exact revenge on the produce racketeer who crippled his father.

filmography.title: Million Dollar Legs
filmography.role_description: An energetic brush salesman who helps the country of Klopstokia enter the Olympics.
filmography.plot: The president of a small country enters his citizens in the Olympic games to save the national treasury.

filmography.title: Lover Come Back
filmography.role_description: A Southern tycoon and client sought after by rival advertising executives.
filmography.plot: Two advertising executives compete for the same account, but complications arise when one impersonates a scientist to win the other's affection.

filmography.title: Around the World in 80 Days
filmography.role_description: The captain of a steamship who is bribed and eventually loses his ship to Phileas Fogg.
filmography.plot: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

filmography.title: Murder at the Vanities
filmography.role_description: The stressed stage manager of a musical revue who tries to hide a murder until the show is over.
filmography.plot: A murder is committed backstage on the opening night of a new musical review, and the stage manager tries to keep the show going while the police investigate.

filmography.title: The Rat Race
filmography.role_description: The owner of a bar who befriends a struggling musician and a dancer.
filmography.plot: A saxophonist and a dancer share an apartment in New York City and try to help each other navigate the harsh realities of the city.

filmography.title: It Happened Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: A member of a performing mind-reading act who interacts with a reporter who can predict the future.
filmography.plot: A reporter receives a newspaper from the future, which allows him to scoop stories but also foretells his own death.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Sound, Best Music

filmography.title: If I Had a Million
filmography.role_description: A soldier who uses his million-dollar check to get thrown in the brig to avoid duties.
filmography.plot: A dying tycoon decides to give his money away to strangers picked from the phone book.

filmography.title: The Toast of New York
filmography.role_description: The jovial partner of financier Jim Fisk during the post-Civil War era.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of Jim Fisk, a jubilant financier who takes on Wall Street and Cornelius Vanderbilt.

filmography.title: The Texas Rangers
filmography.role_description: A former outlaw who joins the Texas Rangers along with his friend, played by Fred MacMurray.
filmography.plot: Two outlaws join the Texas Rangers to get inside information, but one decides to go straight.

filmography.title: Alice in Wonderland
filmography.role_description: One of the famous twins encountered by Alice in this star-studded Paramount adaptation.
filmography.plot: Alice falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar anthropomorphic creatures.

filmography.title: Tin Pan Alley
filmography.role_description: A songwriter struggling to make it in the music business with his partner.
filmography.plot: Two songwriters rise to fame in the years before World War I, dealing with romance and rivalry.

filmography.title: Little Men
filmography.role_description: A con man who tries to exploit the school but is charmed by the children.
filmography.plot: Jo March and her husband run a school for boys, and trouble arises when a streetwise youth arrives.

filmography.title: Hello, Frisco, Hello
filmography.role_description: A vaudevillian performer in San Francisco during the turn of the century.
filmography.plot: A saloon singer in San Francisco's Barbary Coast rises to fame and fortune but never forgets his old friends.

filmography.title: Wintertime
filmography.role_description: A hotel manager trying to keep his resort afloat with the help of a skating star.
filmography.plot: A Norwegian skating star tries to save a failing Canadian hotel from bankruptcy.

filmography.title: The Wonderful Country
filmography.role_description: A character in this western starring Robert Mitchum.
filmography.plot: An American who fled to Mexico after killing his father's murderer returns to the U.S. to buy guns for a Mexican warlord.

filmography.title: Song of the Islands
filmography.role_description: The sidekick to Victor Mature's character in this musical set in Hawaii.
filmography.plot: A wealthy American sails to a tropical island to negotiate a land deal but finds romance instead.

filmography.title: The Great American Broadcast
filmography.role_description: A radio pioneer in this musical comedy about the history of broadcasting.
filmography.plot: Three men and a woman pioneer the development of radio broadcasting from its early days to a national network.

filmography.title: Bowery to Broadway
filmography.role_description: A showman competing with a rival producer in New York.
filmography.plot: Two rival producers on the Bowery move uptown to Broadway, continuing their feud as they find success.

filmography.title: Rise and Shine
filmography.role_description: A dim-witted football star who is kidnapped by gangsters.
filmography.plot: Gangsters kidnap a college football star to prevent him from playing in the big game.

filmography.title: Iceland
filmography.role_description: A Marine stationed in Iceland who tries to help his buddy with romance.
filmography.plot: A Marine in Iceland falls for a local girl, but her family disapproves of his reputation with women.

filmography.title: College Humor
filmography.role_description: A college student in this musical comedy starring Bing Crosby.
filmography.plot: A college professor is forced to resign due to a scandal and becomes a radio crooner.

filmography.title: Sitting Pretty
filmography.role_description: One of two songwriters hitchhiking to Hollywood to make it big.
filmography.plot: Two songwriters travel from New York to Hollywood, hoping to sell their music to the movies.

filmography.title: The Merry Monahans
filmography.role_description: The head of a vaudeville family act.
filmography.plot: A family of vaudeville performers faces ups and downs in their career and personal lives.
